sub_topic: Identifying the clique number of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the graph G given below.

![Graph G](https://i.imgur.com/kUFDx0j.png)

Determine the maximum size of a complete subgraph of G.
message_2:
A complete subgraph is a subgraph in which every pair of distinct vertices is connected by a unique edge. In other words, it is a clique. The maximum size of a complete subgraph is the size of the largest clique in the graph.

In the given graph G, we can observe the following cliques:

1. Triangle formed by vertices A, B, and C.
2. Triangle formed by vertices D, E, and F.

There are no larger cliques in the graph. Therefore, the maximum size of a complete subgraph of G is 3, which corresponds to the two triangles mentioned above.
